cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast parallel to the Carolina coastline, forecast to skirt the North Carolina Outer Banks and then accelerate toward the Canadian Maritimes
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina (Cape Fear-Outer Banks area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch and Tropical Storm Watch areas now extend from the Mid-Atlantic coast north-eastward toward New England and Atlantic Canada.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River, SC to the NC/VA border; Tropical Storm Warning from Edisto Beach, SC to South Santee River, SC and northward to Fenwick Island, DE, portions of Chesapeake Bay, the Tidal Potomac, and Cape Cod/Islands MA.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone now Cape Fear, NC north-eastward through the Outer Banks, southeastern Virginia, and eventually New England coastal waters.
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts possible but unlikely; most winds will remain below gale force at Savannah.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated; surge focus now well north of Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€“3 inches of rain possible as outer rain bands brush coastal Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents will continue along the Georgia coast for the next 24 h.
